Keywords: Armor , Cosmic , Monster , Negative Zone , Ruler
Real Name: Annihilus
Special Powers
ENDLESS RESURRECTION…: POWER: Heal Annihilus equal to to his number of Negative Energy tokens.
…CAN'T…STOP…LIVING…: Invincible. When this click is first revealed, give Annihilus a Negative Energy token.
ANTI-PARTICLES: Outwit. // When Annihilus is attacked, any positive modifiers of the attacker's attack value become negative. When Annihilus attacks a single character, any positive modifiers of the target's defense value become negative.

October 30, 2021
Coyote's Own
A click is revealed at any time it shows up on the dial. you don;t need "land" on the click for it be revealed. Just look at the definition of STOP: "When this click is *revealed* due to damage taken from an opponent’s attack, stop turning the dial."

zharkman

February 24, 2021
Goop
He's expensive but very strong, especially that damage power. Turning their hindering bonus or ESD bonus into negatives almost guarantees he's not going to miss. You also get the NE tokens as you pass the clicks so you will have 4 on the last click if you land there. Also note you never remove the tokens. So once you have your max of 4, its a power action to heal for 4 whenever you want.

I like giving this guy the cosmic cube that came with Kobik. It makes me feel less worried to power action heal and then free move three squares to somewhere safe.

Also remember that he never removes energy tokens. Therefore, once Annihilus reaches his final clix, he can heal 4 clix from the use of a Endless...Resurrection, for the rest of the game, simply through the use of a power action.

August 5, 2020
Maxphyte
Played him in a casual battle royale. He got taken down to near his last click. Opponent made a wrong choice in prioritizing attack order and through a crit hit put him on to his last click which unfortunately for them put him back on Invincible. So a X-23 who i perplexed down to a 2 damage had to rely on BCF instead of exploit weakness to finish off Annihilus. They rolled a 1. Annihilus’ healing at that point was so ridiculous it was almost mathematically impossible for the other teams to take him out. His healing gimmick definitely works better in a non-timed game in order to feel more ridiculous.
